data.title: Galindo Tennis
data.meta_description: Isaac Galindo is Founder and Academy director at Galindo Tennis USA, a subdivision of GMG United, a full-service sports company providing complete management services worldwide. data.text:
Isaac Galindo is Founder and Academy director at Galindo Tennis USA, a subdivision of GMG United, a full-service sports company providing complete management services worldwide.

Isaac brings great expertise in stroke analysis, sports science, and player development. He has put great emphasis in the development of young American athletes by bringing a unique training system based in the Spanish methodology by understanding and applying principles of perfect biomechanics and proper positioning. He also represents and counsels several top ITF/ATP players in the world.

He also started Love 4 Sports Foundation with the goal of helping the community and less fortunate through sports.

COACHING EXPERIENCE

2008-to date

Co-Founder/Director of Tennis (Galindo Tennis Academy)

2007-2008

Assistant Coach at Florida Southern College

2003-2006

Assistant Summer Camp Director at Scripps Ranch Club, San Diego.

2000-2017

ATP Coach (Including Grand Slams and other major ATP events)

ITF Elite Coach training top international junior players (Stephen Madonia (Top 10 US), Benoit Paradis (Top 5 Canada), Isaac Nortey (N-1 Africa) , Stephen Watson (N-5 USA), Ninan Kumar(Top 10 US)

Hitting Partner for ATP/WTA players such as: Conchita Martinez (Wimbledon Champion) Nicolas Almagro (N-9), Adrian Menendez (N-111) Oscar Hernandez (N-48), Anabel Medina, Albert Montanes (N-22), Paradorn Srichaphan (N-9), Roberto Carballes (N-98), Alberto Martin (N-34)

CAREER HIGHLIGHTS

Played professional ATP events around the world

Recorded wins over top ranked junior players (Stanislas Wawrinka – former #3 ATP, Juan Monaco – former #10 ATP)

Competed in top junior events against Spanish and former ATP players (Rafael Nadal – #1 ATP, Juan Carlos Ferrero #1 ATP, David Ferrer #3 ATP, Feliciano Lopez #12 ATP, Oscar Hernandez #48 ATP, etc..)

SSC Commissioner’s List of Outstanding Achievement (2007)

Top ranked national Spanish player

Trained with top 100 ATP players in elite group of Spanish Federation juniors

All-American Collegiate 2005

Ranked #9 in the Nation –Collegiate

Posted a record of 32-6 at Florida Southern College NCAA D2 School in just two seasons leading the team to the highest national ranking in school history (3rd in the country).

CERTIFICATIONS

NCAA Eligibility Coaching Certification (Collegiate Placement and Guidance Certifications) (NFHS)

GPTCA B-Level International Coach (Second highest international certification for ATP coaches at the Challenger and Grand Slam level)

PTR Member

2015/2016 Tennis Congress Faculty Member/Guest Speaker

Psychology of Sport (FSC)

Fitness: Instruction and Prescription (FSC).

EDUCATION
